results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: the big parade
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Tammy Burnstock and Di Drew
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 are always on the lookout for fun while the Teddies and Rat in a Hat are always ready to join in. Life is full of surprises in Cuddles Avenue. There are ten stories in this compilation which include: Pink spots; Rat’s hat; Big parade; Pony ride; Magic lamp; Salon rat; Play time; Treasure hunt, Fire fire and Circus time. In the title episode, B1, B2 and all their friends make their very own circus parade.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: surf's up
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Tammy Burnstock and Di Drew
results.brief_description: B1 and B2, are the much loved “Bananas in Pyjamas” who get up to a little mischief and lots of fun with their friends “The Teddies” on Cuddles Avenue. The ten fun-filled stories featuring the Bananas, the Teddies and a giant rat called “Rat in a hat” are: “Surf’s up”, “Dancing shoes”, “King rat”, “Snow storm”, “Say cheese”, “Spring clean”, “Rat post”, “Model bananas”, “Rat wash” and “Super bananas”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Tammy Burnstock and Di Drew

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: rock-a-bye bananas
results.brief_description: 10 adventures featuring your favourite “Bananas in pajamas” characters. “Rock-a-bye bananas” (dir. David Evans, wri. Richard Tulloch): The bananas buy a hammock and struggle to construct it. “Magic Tolstoy” (dir. David Evans, wri. Simon Hopkinson): B1 and B2 are bamboozled by what appears to be two Tolstoys. “Tortoise wedding” (dir. David Evans, wri. Simon Hopkinson): Tolstoy and Thomasina are marrying and the B1 and B2 are best bananas. “Banana breakfast” (dir. Ian Munro, wri. Debra Oswald): After the teddys leave the bananas a hamper of food, the bananas decide to repay the favour by preparing a special breakfast. “Sneezing time” (dir. Ian Munro, wri. Debra Oswald): Amy buys a new fluffy red jumper and all of a sudden people are allergic to her. “Stepping on cracks” (dir. David Evans, wri. Debra Oswald): The bananas declare today “no stepping on cracks day” which leads to a competition. “Stuck inside” (dir. Ian Munro, wri. Debra Oswald): The teddys are stuck inside their house. “Bedtime bunyip” (dir. Ian Munro, wri. Chris Hawkshaw): B1 and B2 are reading a story about a bunyip and become spooked when they hear strange noises. “Speedy bananas” (dir. Ian Munro, wri. Debra Oswald): The Rat Olympics are on and Rat is winning every race. Amy comes up with a contest to beat him. “Lulu’s yo-yo” (dir. David Evans, wri. Simon Hopkinson): Lulu is upset when the store runs out of yo-yos so the bananas decide to make her one. This DVD also features 30 minutes of nursery rhymes to sing along with.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: monster bananas
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Helena Harris and Tony Tilse
results.brief_description: B1 and B2, the Teddies and the Rat-in-the-hat are up to their old tricks in ten different stories: “Goldilocks Bananas”, “Magic Carpet”, “Wibbly Wobbly”, “Monster Bananas”, “Morgan’s Cubby”, “Ratmobile”, “Strictly Bananas”, “Shadow Painting”, “Banana Shop” and “Mirror Mirror.” Some of the escapades include B1 and B2 disguising themselves as sea-monsters when they find some seaweed on the beach and their crazy attempts at carpentry where they try to mend furniture but end up redesigning it instead!

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: it's music time!
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Helena Harris, Sophia Turkiewicz and Tony Tilse
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 and their friends the Teddies embark on eight terrific adventures. Includes two fun filled songs as well as the famous “Bananas in pyjamas” signature song. All the episodes have a musical theme.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas birthday special
results.brief_description: The bananas, B1 and B2 and the teddies Amy, Lulu and Morgan have lots of fun together and they get up to lots of mischief as well. “Cuddles Avenue” - the naughty bananas decide to play a trick on the teddies. “Birthday Week” - it’s the bananas’ birthday on Friday and the excitement builds as the teddies prepare a surprise party. “Wet Paint” - Amy and Morgan can’t resist touching the brand new paint of the park bench, just to see if it is really wet. “Fancy Dress” - the bananas and teddies have been invited to a fancy dress party.

results.title: Bamiri: the story of a village that helped itself
results.brief_description: The story of a village that helped itself. When the villagers of Bamiri in Ashanti decided to build themselves a Community Centre they scarcely realised how this would stimulate the progress of the village. Now the people of Bamiri are not only improving their village materially, but they are educating themselves in many other ways. No other credits available.

results.title: Bamboozled [DVD]
results.creator_credit: 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Jon Kilik and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Shot on digital video (by cinematographer Ellen Kuras) and taking it’s title from a Malcolm X speech (“You’ve been led astray, led amok, you’ve been bamboozled”), Spike Lee’s “Bamboozled” is an ambitious and contentious satire, a dazzling balancing act that at times strains under it’s own ingenuity but never fails to provoke and challenge. Damon Wayans stars as a successful and affected television executive, Pierre Delacroix, who is pressured by his wannabe home-boy boss (Michael Rapaport) to create a hit series tailored for African Americans. Frustrated by the implicit racism that dominates the entertainment industry, Delacroix comes up with a show that he feels white America really wants to see, a minstrel show called ‘Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show’. His offensive joke backfires however when ‘Mantan’ becomes a runaway success. Lee takes firm pot shots at various institutions, interspersing the film with racially coded advertising and racist images from America’s shameful filmic past (including much loved American classics, “Birth of a nation” and “Gone with the wind”). Not surprising then that Lee dedicates the film to Budd Schulberg, the writer of Eliza Kazan’s 1957 media satire, “A face in the crowd”. Cast includes Jada Pinkett-Smith, Savion Glover and Tommy Davidson.

results.title: Bamboo: plant of a thousand uses
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions, Sterling S Beath and Robert Lang
results.brief_description: Although this is a film about the traditional and everyday uses of bamboo, it also portrays many aspects of contemporary living in Japan; life in urban centres and rural areas and aspects of agriculture, handicrafts, art and types of shelter are explored. This giant grass is noted for its beauty and commercial value and it provides a livelihood for many Japanese families.
